page.title: 08FARMING: WHARTON HALL
page.content: THESE 700 ACRES ARE FARMED BY A FAMILY AND 5 MALE EMPLOYEES.THE FAMILY OCCUPY THE HISTORIC HALL, WHICH WAS THE HOME OF THE LORD WHARTONS. 130 FREISIAN DAIRY COWS ARE KEPT THE AVERAGE MILK YIELD PER COW BEING 5500 LITRES. A TOTAL OF 1800 EWES LAMB EACH YEAR. SWALEDALE AND ROUGH FELL EWES GRAZE ON THE FELLS AND ARE CROSSED WITH SCOTCH BLACKFACED RAMS. OTHERS PRODUCE MULE LAMBS BY THE BLUE FACED LEICESTER RAMS.ABOUT 600 MULE EWES ARE PUT TO SUFFOLK RAMS. IN 1985 TWENTY ACRES OF LAND HAS BEEN PLOUGHED AND RE-SEEDED. TWO CUTS OF GRASS FOR SILAGE ARE MADE EACH YEAR, 185 ACRES BEING MOWN FOR FIRST CUT AND 135 ACRES FOR SECOND CUT. 20 ACRES OF HAY IS ALSO MADE.
